title: Cauchy-Schwarz Inequality
description: |⟨u,v⟩| ≤ ‖u‖·‖v‖. Fundamental to functional analysis and quantum mechanics.

meta.author: Cauchy, Schwarz (formalized in Lean 4 with Mathlib)

overview.historicalContext: Named after Cauchy (1821) and Schwarz (1888), also discovered by Bunyakovsky (1859).
overview.problemStatement:
**Cauchy-Schwarz Inequality**:

$$|\langle u, v \rangle| \leq \|u\| \cdot \|v\|$$

For sequences: $(\sum a_i b_i)^2 \leq (\sum a_i^2)(\sum b_i^2)$
overview.proofStrategy: Follows from (a₁b₂ - a₂b₁)² ≥ 0 and generalizes via quadratic non-negativity.
keyInsights: Equality iff vectors are linearly dependent

conclusion.summary: Cauchy-Schwarz is verified in both inner product and finite sum forms.
